attributes.action: We the undersigned request the Prime Minister to review Section 336 and Section 337 ITEPA 2003, as there is inconsistency by HMRC to interpret the current guidelines for many employees who have to claim back expenses as a result of their employment, such as tool expenses for auto technicians
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Prime Minister

The Trasury fails to give clear guidance on proper procedures about how to claim "tax back" for "tool expenses". Tax offices differ in their interpretation of the facts contained in Section 336 ITEPA 2003.

Many Tax Offices are giving incorrect information and although this is taken up with each office, there has to be clear consensus of "interpretation" of the rules across all tax office.

Some offices are rejecting claims and others are making numerous mistakes that after these mistakes are seen in hindsight, tax offices seem unclear about moving forward.

We ask that HMRC produces a booklet, obtainable easily with clear guidance for the public, how to obtain a legitimate tax refund. Comments like those made by HMRC officers are not necessary as they are a hindrance to claiming tax back. We need a system that will deliver refunds quickly and efficiently and without undue delay.

SIGNED

THE AUTO MECHANIC & "OTHER EMPLOYEES"
